summary:
The Bakersfield Police Department and Kern County Sheriff’s Office arrested more than 50 people on Christmas Eve, according to police records.
Those arrested were taken into custody suspicion of crimes which included battery, vandalism, aggravated assault, driving under the influence, kidnapping, and assault with a deadly weapon.
Additionally, CHP Headquarters tweeted the department is on elevated patrols this holiday:You better watch outYou better not cryYou better not poutI'm telling you whyThe CHP is coming to townWe see you when you're speedingWe know you'll celebrateWe know if you've been bad or goodSo be sure to designateHelp keep the roads safe this holiday season.#DriveSober pic.twitter.com/94CUNzGSgS — CHP Headquarters (@CHP_HQ) December 24, 2019“You better watch outYou better not cryYou better not pout I’m telling you whyThe CHP is coming to townWe see you when you’re speedingWe know you’ll celebrateWe know if you’ve been bad or goodSo be sure to designate

title: Here's your chance to hang with 'Mr. Cooper' in Bakersfield
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Mark Curry, the star from hit 90s show "Hangin' with Mr. Cooper", is making his way to Bakersfield this month.
According to a press release from media company, We Own The Laughs, the comedian is set to take the stage at The Beacon Studios on December 21.
Curry will also be joined by other local comedians, the press release added.
Click here for more ticket information.

title: 1 person killed in crash at I-5, Hwy 99 split in Fort Tejon
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KGET) — CHP says a group of good Samaritans tried to help and rescue a woman who was killed in a crash along Highway 99 near Fort Tejon.
The coroner’s office has identified the woman as 73-year-old Valerie Fernandes Sullivan of Garden Grove.
The crash happened at around 6:12 p.m. in the northbound lanes of Highway 99 near the I-5 split.
When officers arrived they found the Sullivan pinned between the driver’s side door and a concrete guardrail.
Michael Karr said the cause of the crash is under investigation.

title: Pursuit ends in collision in Downtown Bakersfield
summary:
A high-speed chase involving teens behind the wheel of a stolen car ended in a crash in Downtown Bakersfield.
The pursuit ended at around 1 p.m. at 17th and N streets.
According to CHP, two teens were trying to get away in a stolen car, running through red lights and hitting several vehicles along the way.
The teens crash head-on with a man who tells 17 News, he was just out for lunch.
Gaeta says he wasn’t hurt too badly in the crash.

title: Bakersfield Oilers: First local special needs hockey team to play inaugural game this Saturday
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Bakersfield has officially broke the ice on its first-ever special needs hockey team!
The Bakersfield Oilers, will host their first game this weekend at the Valley Children’s Ice Center.
"Affiliated with the American Special Hockey Association, the program is open to both adults and children.
The team practices weekly and no hockey experience is required to join."
The team will face off against another special needs, the Valencia Flyers.

title: Suspect arrested in fatal Motel 6 shooting
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — The Kern County Sheriff's Office has arrested 29-year-old Jose Chavez for murder and attempted murder at a Motel 6.
According to officials, on December 12 around 7 a.m., deputies found 30-year-old Daniel Arturo Gil shot and two others injured when they entered the hotel located at 8223 Brundage Lane.
The other two victims were treated and released.
Anyone with additional information on this homicide is urged to call the Kern County Sheriff’s Office at 661-861-3110 or the Secret Witness Line at 661-322-4040.

title: KCSO deputies found within department policy in deputy-involved shooting, review board said
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif — A review board has found that the Kern County Sheriff deputies who shot and killed 27-year-old Heriberto Rodriguez in December 2019 were within department policy.
According to KCSO, Deputy Angel Leiva, Deputy Ashley Sanchez, Deputy Aaron Carrillo, and Deputy Daniel Garcia have been found withing department policy of use of force.
When deputies arrived at the location, Rodriguez opened the door armed and would not listen to commands, according to KCSO officials.
Rodriguez approached the deputies who then opened fire.
The review board consisted of Chief Deputy Larry McCurtain, Chief Deputy Damian Nord, Chief Deputy Doug Jauch, and Acting Chief Deputy Michael Deleon.

title: 42nd annual Bakersfield Nutcracker Ballet returns for the holidays
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — The Bakersfield Nutcracker Ballet is returning for the holidays!
The annual holiday ballet will set the stage at Mechanics Bank Theater on December 13-15.
They are only about $1,650 dollars away from the funds needed to book the Shafter Symphony Orchestra.
If you would like to help the ballet raise funds for the orchestra there are several ways you can do so.
You can visit the Shafter Symphony Orchestra website and give a straight donation, or you can purchase VIP ticket with a donation.

title: Raising Cane's to open second restaurant in Southwest Bakersfield in November or December
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Raising Cane’s second restaurant expected to open in Bakersfield this fall.
The new restaurant is expected to open on California Avenue in Southwest Bakersfield.
Raising Cane’s currently has job postings online for a general manager for the new store, as well as restaurant managers.
The first Raising Cane’s restaurant opened this February at 3224 Coffee Road in Northwest Bakersfield.
For more information about how to apply for a job at Raising Cane’s visit their careers page on their website: http://www.caniaccareers.com

title: Kaiser Medical Center workers in Bakersfield take part in statewide strike
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — On Monday, thousands of workers at Kaiser Permanente hospitals across California, including the Kaiser Medical Center here in Bakersfield, went on strike as they fight for changes on mental health.
According to our affiliate KABC, workers are demanding better care for their mental health patients - from urgent psychiatric services to better evidence-based treatments.
The group consists mainly of mental health workers from the National Union of Healthcare Workers, KABC reported.
They're demanding better mental care for their patients, like urgent psychiatric services, evidence-based treatments and a more reasonable work environment.
Kaiser Permanente Southern California Region issued its own statement on the strike that read:

title: California Interstates Open After Winter Storm Snarls Traffic
summary: A winter storm shut down several major roads, while chains were required on others. Crews in Southern California worked to clear major roads Friday morning after a winter storm pummeled the state with snow and ice for the second straight night. (MORE: Powerful Winter Storm May Bring Blizzard Conditions, Ice to Plains, Upper Midwest)Holiday travelers were stuck in hours-long traffic jams as they sought alternate routes or got caught up in hazardous road conditions. A portion of SR-76 just west of East Grade Road near Lake Henshaw, California, was closed on Thursday, Dec. 26, 2019, for removal of fallen trees due to the winter storm. Most businesses in the Fargo and Moorhead, Minnesota area were closed or open late on Monday.

title: 70-year-old Oildale woman found safe, reunited with family
summary:
— UPDATE on 12/7/19:According to family members, Carol Pierson-Salmon has been found safe.
Her granddaughter told 23ABC that the 70-year-old has made contact with family and is unharmed.
-----70-year-old Carol Pierson- Salmon has been missing from her home near the 500 block of Willow Dr. since December 1.
She says her grandmother Carol Pierson, usually stays in her room with her cat named Boots.
KCSO says this missing person is not considered a sliver alert because Pierson left voluntarily, but if you have any information please call 661-861-3110.

title: Woman hit by vehicle Saturday evening has died
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KGET) — A woman hit by a vehicle Saturday night has died of her injuries, according to the Bakersfield Police Department.
The coroner’s office has identified the woman as 24-year-old Gabrielle Arroyo of BakersfieldBakersfield police responded to the crash in the 2800 block of Columbus Street on Saturday, just before midnight.
Officers found an adult female pedestrian on the center median suffering from major injuries.
BPD’s investigation found that Arroyo was walking southbound, across Columbus Street, outside of a crosswalk, when she was hit by a vehicle driving east.
The driver of the vehicle remained at the scene.

title: The Country Legacy Of Bakersfield, California — Or Nashville West
summary:
For the full story, click here.
Bakersfield, California, is known as Nashville West.
The city has a rich country music history, and a massive new box set documents that legacy.
It's called "The Bakersfield Sound: County Music Capital Of The West 1940-1975."
Here & Now's Tonya Mosley speaks with Scott B. Bomar, who wrote the book that comes with the new box set "The Bakersfield Sound."

title: Wreaths Across America will lay a wreath at every headstone at the Bakersfield National Cemetery this holiday season
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — It was early this month that Wreaths Across America put out the call for sponsors to help them reach their goal of 5,200 wreaths to lay at the Bakersfield National Cemetery.
Thanks to community support, Wreaths Across America not only has enough wreaths to lay at every headstone at the cemetery, the exceeded their goal by 27.
The Bakersfield Patriot Guard Riders will escort the wreaths truck from the Harley Davidson shop on 7th Standard Rd.
This year, National Wreaths Across America Day is Saturday, December 14, 2019.
The local ceremony at Bakersfield National Cemetery will begin at 9 a.m.

title: Dustin's Diner reopens, looks to give back to the homeless community
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — A popular neighborhood project is getting ready to reopen for business and give back to the Bakersfield Homeless Center.
Dustin's Diner started back in 1993 and was the brainchild of brothers Dustin and David Kilpatrick who were 9 and 11 years old at the time.
It's located in the Haggin Oaks neighborhood which gets decked out in its holiday decorations, lights are lit and cookies, hot chocolate, and apple cider are sold to the community.
The proceeds go to the Bakersfield Homeless Center.
Dustin's Diner opens Friday at 2301 Haggin Oaks Boulevard and goes until December 23rd.

title: Eyewitness News 'Health Alert' for Nov. 24, 2019
25-year-old woman arrested after officials find large amount of drugs, guns
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — The Kern County Sheriff's Office Narcotics Unit and the Department of Homeland Security Investigations arrested a 25-year-old Bakersfield woman for possession of a large amount of methamphetamine, heroin, and fentanyl.
Investigators reportedly seized the following items:Approximately 34lbs of methamphetamine with an estimated street value of $308,720.00.
Approximately 1.45lbs of heroin with an estimated street value of $39,498.00.
1,963 fentanyl pills with an estimated street value of $19,630.00$15,758.00 in currency.
She was booked into the Kern County Sheriff's Office Central Receiving Facility pending court proceedings.

title: UPDATE: Woman found dead in Lamont died from gunshot wound
summary:
UPDATE: KCSO has confirmed that Fernandez died from a gunshot wound to the head.
UPDATE: KCSO has identified the woman killed as 36-year-old Lorena Fernandez.
LAMONT, Calif. (KGET) — Kern County Sheriff’s Office deputies were called out to the area of School Street and Myrtle just after 6 A.M. on Saturday.
Deputies were on scene for about three hours investigating what they’re calling, the suspicious death of a person.
Homicide detectives are investigating the case.

title: Come drop off your new, unwrapped toys for the annual 'CHiPs for KiDs' toy drive
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — It's that time of year again: the California Highway Patrol Bakersfield Area will host its tenth annual CHiPs for KiDs Toy Drive!
For over 25 years, the CHiPs for KiDs toy drive has helped families.
Toys collected from the drive benefit local children aged 0 to 16.
Also on Friday, December 6 there will be a to drop off event downtown, on the corner of Chester Avenue and 28th Street, from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. You can drop off your new unwrapped toy and be on your way in no time.
If you have any questions or need additional information on drop off locations please contact Public Information Officer Robert Rodriguez, at (661) 396-6653.

title: Public health confirmed fourth flu death in Kern County
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Kern County Public Health confirmed that another person has died in Kern County due to the flu, bringing the total number of flu deaths in the county to four for the 2019-2020 flu season.
According to public health the first death was reported back in December, 2019.
The Kern County Department of Public Health suggests that the best defense against the flu still remains the current flu vaccine.
Public health said the flu affects mostly children that are 6 months of age or younger because they cannot get vaccinated.
According to public health, bacteria can live on a surface for up to 24 hours.

title: Woman struck by vehicle is in critical condition
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KGET) — Bakersfield police responded to call about a vehicle crash on the 2800 block of Columbus Street on Saturday at 11:52 p.m.
Upon arrival, officers found an adult female pedestrian on the center median who suffered major injuries.
Investigation revealed that the female pedestrian was walking southbound, across the 2800 block of Columbus Street, outside of a crosswalk, when she was struck by a vehicle that was traveling eastbound.
The victim was transported to a local hospital and is in critical condition.
The 2700-2900 blocks of Columbus Street were temporarily closed for approximately two hours during the investigationNo names have been released at this time.

title: Police search for hit-and-run driver who struck man picking up debris that flew out of his own truck
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KGET) — Bakersfield police say a driver who stopped to pick up debris that was flying out of his truck, has suffered life-threatening injuries after he was struck by a passing vehicle Friday evening in South Bakersfield.
Police were called to the 8300 block of Shannon Drive at around 6:50 p.m.
A police department spokesperson described the man’s injuries as life-threatening late Friday.
Police are looking for the driver of the vehicle that struck the truck driver, but did not have a description of the suspect vehicle.
Anyone with information is asked to call Bakersfield police at 327-7111.

title: Think Green: How to stay off the naughty list when getting rid of your Christmas tree
summary:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Kern County Public Works has reminded residents to recycle their Christmas trees!
County officials are providing free recycling and composting options and have listed ways you can stay off their naughty list even after Christmas:1) In the metro-Bakersfield area, residents can place Christmas trees into their GREEN WASTE CONTAINER as long as the tree is cut into small pieces and the container lid is completely closed.
The garbage hauler will take it to the Mount Vernon Green Waste Recycling Facility.
2) Residents can self-haul whole Christmas trees to one of 23 drop-off locations throughout Kern County (see attached list) from December 26, 2019 to January 10, 2020.
Your Christmas tree can be cut up and used in your own compost pile as part of your healthy compost mix.

title: Woman's purse stolen at gas station, says thieves then came to her house and stole her car
summary:
According to BPD, on Saturday November 30 a 70-year-old woman's purse was stolen from her car while she was getting gas at the Velardo gas station on South Union.
In exclusive surveillance video obtained by 23ABC you can see both a man and another person step outside of a dark blue Chrysler at the gas station.
A person exits the Chrysler and steals the woman's purse along with spare car keys.
If you have information on the stolen purse, call BPD at 327-7111.
If you have information on the stolen car call KCSO at 861-3110.
